forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 1am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. North northwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening descends over Downtown San Francisco, a soft blanket of clouds veils the city, lending an air of mystery to the familiar skyline. The lingering chill whispers promises of rain, with a subtle breeze rustling through the streets. The forecast hints at scattered showers late tonight, so a light jacket will serve well for those wandering outside. Temperatures hover around a chill-inducing fifty degrees, urging one to embrace layers rather than risk the cold.

Wednesday greets you with a similar mood, as rain remains a possibility even amidst fleeting moments of sunshine. The air will carry a refreshing bite, with high temperatures struggling to reach fifty-seven before a gentle descent in the afternoon. It’s a day best suited for leisurely pursuits, perhaps a stroll through a cozy gallery or an immersive visit to a local bookstore, where the scent of coffee mingles with the rustle of pages. Bring along that ever-reliable umbrella as you navigate the whims of the weather, allowing the city’s charm to embrace you fully, even in this somewhat overcast chapter.
